page.title: 07E.WAITE O.B.E. HAYDON BRIDGE
page.content: {Edward Waite}is 75 yrs.old. Born the son of a gamekeeper he spent his youth at{Ridley Hall}and, apart from his education in London, has lived in the Tyne Valley. Following teaching at {Shaftoe Trust}and as Headmaster at {Humshaugh,}he returned to Shaftoe Trust as Headmaster. He created Haydon Technical School together with a 180 acre{School Farm.}In 1962 he was awarded the O.B.E. for services to Education and emphasising his drive for improved opportunities for pupils. He is a life member of the Federation of Young Farmers Clubs. As a councillor he founded Tynedale Sports council and spearheaded the drive for the Tynedale Open Recreation Centre for the handicapped. Mr.Waite has dedicated his life to the service of the community. He has no children. His heirs are the young people of Tynedale
